Repeat

  • Shortcuts
  • Build and Reload Cmd+Shift+B
  • Load All (devtools) Cmd+Shift+L
    • devtools::load_all() # Cmd+Shift+L
  • Document Package
    • devtools::document() # Cmd+Shift+D
  • Check Package Shift+Cmd+E
    • devtools::check() WARNING deletes doc/inst
  • Test Package Cmd+Shift+T
  • Restart R Session Cmd+Shift+F10
# all the time, incl tar_make
devtools::load_all() # Cmd+Shift+L 
# via tar_make preamble
usethis::use_pipe() 

devtools::document() # Cmd+Shift+D

# FIXME: 
#   nix: ld: library not found for -lintl

# devtools::check() WARNING deletes doc/inst
# pkgbuild::check_build_tools(debug = TRUE)
# https://community.rstudio.com/t/using-devtools-check-to-account-for-private-packages/22309/4
readRenviron("check.env")

  • if not going to CRAN (me) => move all pkgs to Depends
  • use usethis:: to auto manage DESCRIPTION <-> NAMESPACE mapping i.e. never edit namespace

Packages pkgs_dependency is not just reading DESCRI?PTION but also returning its dependency => number of package s > 100 CRAN max allowed is 20 compare to devtools::check

  • WARNING: CI
    • => minimal docker environments
    • => ONLY imports in DESCRIPTION
      • not our Suggests
        • NOT our package’s Suggests dependencies
          • e.g. {svglite}
      • i.e. our package’s imports own dependencies, & their own imports

github_actions

  • RIX GH workflows

    • https://github.com/b-rodrigues/rix/tree/master/.github/workflows

    • https://github.com/JohnGavin/test_nixpkgs/blob/main/.github/workflows/test_pkgs.yml

    • https://orchid00.github.io/actions_sandbox/index.html#what-are-github-actions ’’‘{r} usethis::use_github_action_check_standard(save_as = “R-CMD-check.yaml”) usethis::use_github_action_check_release(save_as = “R-CMD-check.yaml”) use_github_action()’’’

  • https://orchid00.github.io/actions_sandbox/index.html#what-are-github-actions
  • https://docs.ropensci.org/targets/reference/tar_github_actions.html
  • https://github.com/ThinkR-open/attachment/blob/master/dev/dev_history.R
  • https://ryo-n7.github.io/2021-09-23-CanPL-GoogleDrive-GithubActions-Tutorial/
    • Write .github/workflows/targets.yaml workflow file and commit this file to Git
      • tar_github_actions()
    • upload the results to the targets-runs branch of your repository.
    • Subsequent runs add new commits but not necessarily rerun targets
  • If CI (GH actions) yaml uses devtools::install()
    • => Suggests packages not installed
      • => devtools::install()(dep = TRUE) in your yaml file ?
  • {svglite} in {ggplot2}’s suggests, not imports
    • https://rtask.thinkr.fr/tame-your-namespace-with-a-dash-of-suggests
    • https://rtask.thinkr.fr/checkhelper-is-on-cran-so-you-dont-have-to-be-afraid-to-run-a-check/
    • Adding {svglite} to Depends
      • devtools::check() warns if mandatory dependencies (imports) > 21
    • => put as many dependencies as possible in Suggests
    • Suggests iff
    • dependencies intended for developers (e.g. {testthat})
    • vignettes call ggplot2::ggplot (https://adv-r.hadley.nz/)
      • => Suggests: ggplots
      • not necessarily useful to user, including :
        • packages associated with functions that are rarely used by the user!
        • packages used only in examples, tests and/or vignettes
    • if dependency on {svglite} in deptrapr::save_plot() :
      • imports if : save_plot() is a flagship function of the package it is regularly used (in which case we can add svg to the default formats)
      • suggest if : save_plot() is a very rarely used function it is only used in the save_plot() example Note that, with this way of doing things, no need to wait until you’ve got 21 dependencies to start sorting, right ?
  • delete previous roxygen2 line to remove the {svglite} imports
    • usethis::usepackage(package = "svglite", type = "Suggests")
    • AND suggests => add if(requireNamespace()) {…} else {…}
      • cf usethis::usepackage() output
  • avoid conflicts: Packages not imported
    • => not part of the NAMESPACE
    • => call as pkg::function() in your code
      • e.g. ALL Suggests functions used?

{attachment} makes it easier to manage the dependencies

  • if not going to CRAN move all to Depends usethis::
    • auto-manages DESCRIPTION <-> NAMESPACE mapping

+ {cli} has special inline markup classes.

  + "`path` is missing." -> "{.code path} is missing."
    + render actual path via second curly braces "{.path {path}} already exists."
  + add another info message with example:
"i" = "For example, {.code create_soils('path/to/my/directory')}"
  + TODO: newline fails in cli::cli_inform
    + "i" = "To always overwrite: \\  
{.code create_soils({.path {path}} overwrite = TRUE)}" # newline inside
      + // add new line in {cli} message

+ base pipe used?
  + DESCRIPTION to depend on R ≥ 4.1.
    + usethis::?

  • {styler} else {grkstyle} Consistent styling
    • run {grkstyle} after a chunk of refactoring
    • Cntrl+Shft+S via grkstyle?
  • Add data dictionary
    • what each column means & what for i.e. why care
    • units
      • units in brackets so you regex them
      • store units as attributes
      • units into object vectors?
        • roxyglobals:: write all globals (incl dups) to R/globals.R
        • https://github.com/anthonynorth/roxyglobals
        • https://github.com/njtierney/naniar/blob/master/R/naniar-package.R
        • checkhelper::print_globals()
  • Generate example data via R script for reproducability
    • example table / graph - show things u care about
  • Error messages:
    • say what is needed
      • not what is missing
      • if (!isTRUE(overwrite)) v if (isFALSE(overwrite))
        • if overwrite not user-defined => (isFALSE(overwrite)) is ok?
    • example of what code should look like
  • unravel confusing ifelse logic via docs/comments
  • commit message template
    • “this commit will …”
    • use headlines and bullet points
      • [this commit will]… * use tests and snapshot
    • add a summary headline testing ``` # header NB: no markup language Tests, snapshots, base pipe: # dotpoints (not +)
  • use tests and snapshot testing
  • depend on R 4.1.0 since |> is used

    + Push PR 
      + https://github.com/WA-Department-of-Agriculture/soils/pull/3

+ add URL of exact commit of functions adapted from other packages to doc for ur function

+ use 3 if stmts to emph each case:
  + if (dir_exists && !overwriting) {...}
  + if (dir_exists && overwriting) {...} 
    + cli msg re overwriting existing project
  + if (!dir_exists) {...}
  + capture intent: 
    + wrap each case in function:  stop_if_dir_exists_and_overwriting(dir_exists, overwriting) {...}
      + eaier to browse/maintain code

+ suppressWarnings wrapped around {ggplot2} code
  + link to cli? post about one warning per session?

goodpractice::gp() # good practices wrt new package

# snapshot errors outputs
# https://jadeyryan.com/blog/2024-01-22_package-review/#testing
usethis::use_testthat("create_soils returns appropriate error", {
  # Run once: snapshot of error message -> tests/testthat/_snaps/create-soils.md
  # Run again shows test passed
  # Changed "`path` is missing." → "{.path path} must be provided.".
  #   Tells user you must provide the path
  # Click(?) testthat::snapshot_review('create-soils') to interactively review this change.
  #   Shows the diff, which is what we want. Click Accept.
  expect_snapshot_error(
    create_soils()
  )
})
library(targets)
tar_config_set(script = 'R/_targets.R') 
# rstudioapi::restartSession() # tar_config_get needs restart
tar_config_get('script') # set in _targets.yaml
# create initial ./R/_targets.R file (pipeline defn)
tar_script(list(tar_target(x, 1 + 1)))
tar_make() # writes to data 'store' in _targets.yaml
tar_manifest()
tar_outdated()
tar_visnetwork()
use_r("function_name")
# https://r-pkgs.org/workflow101.html#sec-workflow101-load-all Cmd+Shift+L 
devtools::load_all() # Cmd+Shift+L 
# devtools::check() WARNING deletes doc/inst
# + NB: defaults 
#   + `install.packages(dep = T)` v 
#   + `remotes::install_github(dep = F)`
# checkhelper::print_globals()
# TODO: dashboard
use_vignette("How to do this cool analysis")
# tar_quarto() and tar_render() render documents as targets in the pipeline
# https://wlandau.github.io/rpharma2023/#/example-literate-programming
# usethis::use_test("create-<pkg-nm>") to create test-create-<pkg-nm>.R template to modify.
usethis::use_test("my-test")
x <- 1
y <- 2
use_data(x, y)
